Subject: Update OS
Description: We recently implemented a security tool that shows our endpoint protector EC2 instance has several critical vulnerabilities associated with it, but I can't SSH into it to update and the web server isn't giving me any updates to run. I'd love some help getting this thing up to date!
What_We_Know__c:
3/21/25

- Sent customer follow up email requesting if she had further questions or would like for me to close the case
3/14/2025

- Sent customer email detailing steps to migrate old epp server to new epp server

3/13/2025
- Customer is wanting to know what it would take to migrate to ubuntu 22
- Working on steps to send to customer that is hosting EPP server on AWS
- Sending response email once steps are created and speaking with team on next steps

3/5/2025
Hosted in Customer AWS

- Joined remote session

- EPP Version is at 5.9.4.1

- ssh problems? they have to open the port 62828 in order to ssh on it

- Added screen shot to attachments of security scan results

- php version can not be updated. Current PHP version 5.2.17. Linux Ubuntu 18.04.6.

- Customer could migrate server to a newer version.

* Created an ADO asking the engineers on status of the php upgrade process. Ticket Number # 00437858

2/27/205
- Customer recently used a security tool and found several vulnerabilities associated with EPP
- Sent customer email requesting confirmation of EPP version 5.9.4.0
Solution_Comment__c: Customer had questions relating to the mysql version running and vulnerabilities associated with the version. Responded to customer with: Netwrix has obtained extended life support for Ubuntu 18, and thus these instances receive security updates. If preferred, Netwrix can migrate your instance to one running Ubuntu 22. Netwrix is aware of the out-of-date PHP version and the Endpoint Protector development team is actively working on a project to update, in phases, to a supported version of PHP. We anticipate the first phase of these updates to occur within 4 months."
